message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SD, cs.HC, cs.IR 

This paper focuses on the development of intelligent assistants (IAs) and their ability to conversationally interact with users. The paper proposes a method to predict the causes of reformulation, which is a useful signal of user dissatisfaction. This topic is closely related to natural language processing (NLP) and human-computer interaction (HCI), which are both sub-categories of computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Additionally, the paper involves the use of machine learning algorithms to predict the causes of reformulation, which falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also uses user logs to evaluate the proposed method, which is related to the sub-category of cs.SD (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper involves the use of search algorithms to execute a wide range of actions, which is related to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
